text: Hello :wave:  Can we consume an external api within the CRM extension or consuming external API’s have to be done within the app.functions?
Hi David, as we discussed over call, you have to use serverless functions today. Let's schedule another call to discuss your poinpoints on data fetching in general.

<@U0307KJQREH> You should have an account with Sales or Service Hub enterprise to access this beta. It is not available in developer accounts, yet.

And JSON-based cards are being sunset, so I advise against using them.
Is it possible to create UI extensions in the conversation view of HubSpot or only standard/custom objects?

Hey there just want to correct some information to prevent mismatched expectations.

> This is now a public beta so no breaking changes will be made without at least 90 days of notice
Public Betas are exempt from the 90 days of notice that we afford to functionality that is fully released and generally available.

The purpose of a beta is to enable HubSpot to release an early version of functionality, and be able to learn from the feedback of those using it how to make it better. ensuring we don’t release functionality that is completely out of line with customer and developer expectations and doesn’t meet needs properly.

To be able to keep innovating quickly during the beta periods there is no across the board standard of announcement that we use. We encourage individual teams that own betas to recognize the size of the affected audience and level of impact of a change and try to provide a reasonable heads up, but it CAN be less than 90 days.

We encourage anyone participating in a beta to be transparent with any stakeholders that they are using beta functionality and it is subject to possible change.
Thank you <@U03FJQPSC0Y>

Hi everyone,

Please I am trying to work with the Snowflake SDK within the react cards. Is this a mistake on my part or there are specific modules supported within the serverless functions…

I am importing as follows

`const axios = require('axios');`
`const snowflake = require('snowflake-sdk')`

Try changing the `circleSize` of your StepIndicator? Does that make the variant appear?

cc: <@U04HWGVKYM7>
I'm using the default variant here with big circles and it doesnt seem to work (?). It would be nice to have pics of each variant to know how they should look because right now I'm clueless
if you `cd` into the app.functions folder and then run `npm install` and then try to run this card what happens?
I would wrap the step component in a flex and set the flex to width= 'min'
this should allow you to see what the different variants look like, right now you're having a hard time seeing them because it's getting squished
Ohh I'll try that! thank you guys for your help
<@U01QVR44MEY> Flex using Justify = between worked. Thank you :partyparrot:

:wave-yeti: <@U03BA1PRV7S>, I hear you are having some issues with actions! I am happy to help!

Can you please post a short summary of the problem you are running into and the code you currently have in the :thread:
Hi Deidra, whenever I try to deploy the component CrmCardActions component this happens

I'm also not sure if I'm using the component the right way because the documentation is confusing. In the example here only 1 component is used  but then if you look below there are examples that use CrmActionButton so not sure if I should combine them or what<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#action-menu>

Try using this import:
```import { CrmCardActions } from @HubSpot/ui-extensions/crm```
The crm data components live one level deeper than the standard components
Agreed, the docs have really outgrown their current format. We are actively looking into a better way to document these!
I am importing the component as you mentioned
When I dont import the component I get a different error: like "Component doesnt exist" in the console, but it still deploys. This time is not even deploying
Do you have the latest version of `@HubSpot/ui-extensions`?
Yes I did update to the latest version recently
I copied that from the example but then in this image it shows up differently so its a bit confusing
Not sure why the CrmActionButton component is in the CRM card actions section :thinking_face: unless I should use both at the same time in some way?

Can you double check that you have the `/crm` at the end of your import? I can repro the error if I don’t have that:

CORRECT IMPORT
```import { CrmCardActions } from @HubSpot/ui-extensions/crm```
INCORRECT IMPORT
```import { CrmCardActions } from @HubSpot/ui-extensions```
I don't have the /crm in the path :0

There are three components that allow the use of actions:
1. `CrmActionButton`
2. `CrmActionLink`
3. `CrmCardActions`
The `CrmCardActions` component adds the ability to place buttons and dropdown in the top right corner of the card.

The two other components allow actions to be used anywhere within the card
Ok so all the other components failed so I figured this is the way to do this
Now its working thanks so much. I don't think I would have solved that without your help
Yes, perfect!! You are very welcome! Happy to help!!!
Currently no but you can build them on the tickets record page
The thing is the client doesn't create each message into a ticket/deal. If i build a custom card on the ticket its going to appear in the inbox view even if there is no ticket?
Or is there a way to use conditional properties here to achieve the desired functionality mentioned above?
